data.taskTitle: Add tree change detection to expanded subdirectories
Add tree change detection to expanded subdirectories
data.approach: Extend checkForTreeChanges() to also check expanded directories stored in loadedFolders Map. Generate fingerprints for each expanded folder and compare on polling. When any folder changes, show the update indicator.

data.taskTitle: Add tree change detection to expanded subdirectories
summary: Extended FileTree change detection to track expanded subdirectories
Changed single fingerprint string to Map<path, fingerprint>
Updated checkForTreeChanges() to poll root AND all expanded folders
Updated handleToggleFolder() to store fingerprints when folders load
Updated handleTreeUpdate() to refresh all expanded folders on update
Build and type check pass with no new errors

suggestedTasks.title: Add Unit Tests for Recursive File Tree Change Detection
suggestedTasks.description: Create comprehensive test suite to validate the new recursive change detection mechanism in file tree components. Tests should cover scenarios like nested directory changes, mixed file/folder updates, and edge cases with deep directory structures. Focus on testing the change tracking logic in SupabasePanel and Sidebar components.
suggestedTasks.reason: Ensure reliability of new change detection implementation

suggestedTasks.title: Document File Tree Change Detection Mechanism
suggestedTasks.description: Create technical documentation explaining the new recursive change detection approach. Include details about how changes are tracked across expanded subdirectories, the underlying logic, and any potential performance considerations. Update developer README or component documentation to provide clear guidance for future maintenance.

patterns: State management for expanded directory structures
gotchas: Ensure performance is not significantly impacted by deep directory scanning
Handle edge cases with large numbers of nested directories

documentationNeeds: Create technical notes on recursive file tree change detection
